channel.title: BBC Sport - Formula 1
channel.description: The latest stories from the Formula 1 section of the BBC Sport web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Hamilton takes pole in wet Malaysia
item.description: Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton pips Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel to pole position in a wet qualifying session at the Malaysian GP.

item.title: Hamilton proud to match Clark poles
item.description: Lewis Hamilton says he is "proud" to equal Jim Clark's record for most pole positions by a British driver.

item.title: Horner critical of fuel-flow sensors
item.description: Red Bull team boss Christian Horner says fuel-flow sensors must be improved and the FIA needs a "better solution".

item.title: Ecclestone U-turn on engine criticism
item.description: F1 boss Bernie Ecclestone admits he was too critical of the sound produced by the new engines introduced this year.

item.title: New engines good for F1 - Rosberg
item.description: Mercedes driver Nico Rosberg defends F1's new format following criticism of the spectacle and the engine sound.

item.title: F1 to honour missing plane passengers
item.description: Formula 1 will pay tribute to the passengers on missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 at Sunday's grand prix at Sepang.

item.title: Rosberg heads Hamilton in practice
item.description: Nico Rosberg heads Lewis Hamilton in a Mercedes one-two in final practice at the Malaysian Grand Prix.

item.title: Vettel & Franklin win Laureus awards
item.description: Sebastian Vettel and Missy Franklin win Laureus World Sportsman and Sportswoman of the year awards.

item.title: Rosberg quickest in Malaysia practice
item.description: Mercedes driver Nico Rosberg beats Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen to set fastest time in second practice at the Malaysian GP.

item.title: Hamilton top in Malaysia practice
item.description: Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton sets the pace from Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen in first practice at the Malaysian Grand Prix.

item.title: Red Bull 'may quit F1', says owner
item.description: Dietrich Mateschitz says the team's future could be at risk because of decisions made by F1 authorities.

item.title: Red Bull given Ricciardo appeal date
item.description: Red Bull will have their appeal against Daniel Ricciardo's disqualification from the Australian GP heard on 14 April.

item.title: F1 dispute over 'too quiet' engines
item.description: McLaren team boss Eric Boullier defends Formula 1's new engines after complaints they have an uninspiring sound.

item.title: Ferrari performance 'not acceptable'
item.description: Ferrari's poor display in the Australian GP was unacceptable, according to technical director James Allison.

item.title: FIA backs fuel sensor manufacturer
item.description: The FIA backs the fuel sensor manufacturers in the row over Red Bull driver Daniel Ricciardo's disqualification.

item.title: Halt racetrack state aid, PM urged
item.description: Silverstone asks the prime minister to prevent millions of pounds of potentially "illegal" state aid for a new £280m circuit in Wales, it is reported.

item.title: Hamilton unfazed by Australia exit
item.description: Lewis Hamilton says he is "quite relaxed" about retiring from the first race of the season while team-mate Nico Rosberg won.

item.title: Magnussen delight at 'dream' debut
item.description: McLaren's Kevin Magnussen says coming third on his Formula 1 debut at the Australian Grand Prix was "a dream".

item.title: Alonso unhappy with performance
item.description: Fernando Alonso admitted Ferrari were "not happy" with their performance after finishing fifth in the Australian Grand Prix.

item.title: Rosberg wins eventful Australian GP
item.description: Nico Rosberg delivers on Mercedes' promise as favourites, with a dominant victory in the season-opening Australian GP.

item.title: VIDEO: F1: Malaysian GP qualifying
item.description: Watch BBC coverage of qualifying for the Malaysian Grand Prix from Sepang.

item.title: VIDEO: Dramatic crash ends Ericsson's wet debut
item.description: Caterham's Marcus Ericsson gets out of shape on the exit of Turn Three and runs onto the grass, before clattering into the barrier and spinning across the track.

item.title: VIDEO: Hamilton's pole lap in Malaysia rain
item.description: Lewis Hamilton grabs his second successive pole for Mercedes in qualifying in the rain at the Malaysian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Rosberg fastest in second practice
item.description: Watch highlights as Mercedes driver Nico Rosberg beats Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen to set the fastest time in second practice at the Malaysian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Hamilton sets pace in first practice
item.description: Watch highlights as Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton sets the pace from Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen during first practice at the Malaysian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Everything you need to know on Sepang
item.description: BBC Sport assesses what makes the Sepang International Circuit, home of the Malaysian Grand Prix, so special.

item.title: VIDEO: Webber & Vettel do battle in Malaysia
item.description: Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel ignores team orders as he battles with team-mate Mark Webber for the lead of the 2013 Malaysian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Highlights: Vettel wins in Malaysia
item.description: Watch race highlights as Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel ignores team orders and overtakes his team-mate Mark Webber to win the Malaysian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Classic F1 - Malaysia 2009
item.description: Jenson Button wins the Malaysian Grand Prix as the race is abandoned because of heavy rain. (UK users only)

item.title: VIDEO: Hamilton 'proud' to match GB record
item.description: Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton says he wants to convert poles into wins after qualifying fastest at the Malaysian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Pole was there for the taking - Vettel
item.description: Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel believes pole position was there for the taking despite only qualifying second fastest for the Malaysian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Rain hits Malaysian Grand Prix
item.description: Heavy rain brought disruption to qualifying at Sepang on Saturday, can we expect more of the same on Sunday? Elizabeth Saary takes a look.

item.title: VIDEO: 'Professor Rosberg' explains F1 turbos
item.description: Mercedes driver Nico Rosberg explains the physics of Formula 1's new turbo engines to BBC Sport's Lee McKenzie.

item.title: VIDEO: The pill that takes drivers' temperature
item.description: Mark Webber meets Dr Simon Sostaric to talk about the pill that drivers take to measure their core temperature during hot Formula 1 races.

item.title: VIDEO: Sepang tough circuit for McLaren - Button
item.description: Jenson Button is hopeful McLaren will keep improving this weekend in Sepang but plays down his chances of being able to win this weekend's Malaysian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Malaysian F1 Grand Prix
item.description: From qualifying to race day, Ian Fergusson takes a look at the weather prospects in Sepang this weekend.

item.title: VIDEO: Coulthard swaps pit lane for cockpit
item.description: BBC F1 co-commentator David Coulthard swaps the pit lane for the cock pit as he takes a ride in a Royal Australian Air Force jet.

item.title: VIDEO: BBC pundits on Ricciardo exclusion
item.description: David Coulthard and Allan McNish on the exclusion of Red Bull's Daniel Ricciardo from the Australian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Horner surprised by Ricciardo exclusion
item.description: Red Bull team principal Christian Horner says his team will appeal after Daniel Ricciardo was excluded from the Australian Grand Prix after breaching fuel consumption rules.

item.title: VIDEO: Mercedes speed is cool - Rosberg
item.description: Nico Rosberg says driving a "dominant" car for the first time in his F1 career is "so cool" after winning the Australian Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Hamilton & Vettel explain retirements
item.description: Lewis Hamilton and Sebastian Vettel explain their unfortunate starts to the Formula 1 season after they were both forced to retire early on during the season-opening Australian Grand Prix.

item.title: Malaysian GP: Wet, wild & unpredictable
item.description: Formula 1 heads to Malaysia for the second race of the season after a dramatic opener in Australia

item.title: F1's greatest drivers - Jim Clark
item.description: Legendary commentator Murray Walker and chief F1 writer Andrew Benson look at the career of Jim Clark.

item.title: 'Quiet' engine debate rumbles on
item.description: Bernie Ecclestone surely has more pressing issues to deal with in F1 than engine noise, says BBC Sport's Andrew Benson

item.title: Ricciardo justified Red Bull selection - Coulthard
item.description: New Red Bull driver Daniel Ricciardo is already showing himself a worthy replacement for Mark Webber, says David Coulthard

item.title: 'Mercedes may be unstoppable in new era'
item.description: Nico Rosberg shows Mercedes' superiority and it is unclear whether anyone can challenge them, says Andrew Benson

item.title: Formula 1 on the BBC in 2014
item.description: Details of the BBC's 2014 Formula 1 coverage across television, radio, online and mobile

item.title: The ultimate Formula 1 league table
item.description: Using the current Formula 1 points system, BBC Sport ranks drivers from 1950-2013 based on wins, poles, points and titles

item.title: All aboard the 'power train' - 2014 rules explained
item.description: BBC Sport explains Formula 1's regulation changes, radical redesigns and how they could spice up the on-track action

item.description: Kamui Kobayashi at Caterham.

item.description: Marcus Ericsson at Caterham.

item.description: A profile of the 2007 Formula 1 champion, Kimi Raikkonen.

item.description: A profile of Force India's German driver.

item.title: Romain Grosjean

item.title: Jules Bianchi

item.description: A profile of the 2009 Formula 1 champion, Jenson Button.

item.description: A profile of the 2008 Formula 1 champion, Lewis Hamilton.

item.title: Nico Rosberg
item.description: A profile of the German F1 driver, Nico Rosberg.

item.title: Sebastian Vettel
item.description: A profile of the four-time Formula 1 champion.

item.title: Daniel Ricciardo
item.description: A profile of Red Bull's Australian driver, who was formerly at Toro Rosso.

item.description: A profile of Toro Rosso's French driver.

item.description: A profile of Williams' Brazilian driver.

item.title: Valtteri Bottas
item.description: A profile of Williams's Finnish driver.

item.title: Formula 1: The new cars for 2014
item.description: A look at the new cars that each team will be driving this season

item.title: Michael Schumacher: a career in pictures
item.description: A look back at the Formula 1 career of Michael Schumacher, who retired for the final time at the Brazilian Grand Prix in 2012.

item.title: VIDEO: Highlights: Hamilton beats Vettel to pole
item.description: Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton pips Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel to pole position in a wet qualifying session at the Malaysian GP.

item.title: VIDEO: Webber: Getting cooked in an F1 car
item.description: Former Formula 1 driver Mark Webber shows how he used to prepare for racing in extreme heat and humidity to prevent him "getting cooked in the car".
